page.title: 20MEMORIES
page.content: Mr.Fish told us about life in the village when he was a boy 60 years ago.As 5 he started school at the village hall,and at 8 moved to our school.He remembers children coming to school without shoes.The lessons were the same in every class but they just got harder.On leaving school at 14 he worked at Naylor's pipeworks.The tennis court in the park was once a swimming pool packed with people in the summer.There used to be a golf corse there too.Transport in the village was by bicycle and horse drawn carts.The village had only half as many houses as we have today,but the population was the same because people had larger families.
